      public void addBehavior​(int priority, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Behaviour behaviour)
      Gives the enemy actor the ability to have multiple behaviours
      Parameters:
      priority - the order in which behaviours should execute based on their importance
      behaviour - the behaviour to be used

    • playTurn

      public edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actions.Action playTurn​(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actions.ActionList actions, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actions.Action lastAction, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.positions.GameMap map, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.displays.Display display)
      At each turn, select a valid action to perform.
      Specified by:
      playTurn in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
      Parameters:
      actions - collection of possible Actions for this Actor
      lastAction - The Action this Actor took last turn. Can do interesting things in conjunction with Action.getNextAction()
      map - the map containing the Actor
      display - the I/O object to which messages may be written
      Returns:
      the valid action that can be performed in that iteration or null if no valid action is found

    • allowableActions

      public edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actions.ActionList allowableActions​(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor otherActor, java.lang.String direction, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.positions.GameMap map)

      Parameters:
      otherActor - the Actor that might be performing attack

      map - current GameMap
      Returns:
      ActionList actions.
